benchmark_details.name: MMDU (Multi-Turn Multi-Image Dialog Understanding)
benchmark_details.overview: MMDU is a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate and improve Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) abilities in multi-turn and multi-image conversations, addressing the limitations of existing benchmarks which primarily focus on single-choice questions or short-form responses.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the multi-turn, multi-image dialog understanding capabilities of LVLMs, specifically designed for human-AI interaction.

data.source: Data is sourced from Wikipedia entries, including images and textual information, which are clustered and annotated for creating multi-turn dialogues.
data.annotation: Human annotators reviewed and verified the dialogues generated with the assistance of the GPT-4o model.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the output quality in response to questions generated using the benchmark.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better understanding and reasoning abilities of the models evaluated.
methodology.baseline_results: The best open-source model scores 42.8%, whereas closed-source models like GPT-4o reach 70.2%.
methodology.validation: Benchmark validated using multiple rounds of human and model evaluations to ensure reliability and performance.
